121212111111111.title: Toe Tickling

choices: Run past the stewardess
Cower near Caitlyn's mother
1212121111111111.content:
You walk calmly down the central toe, surprised at the spring it gives your step, and disgusted by the girth of the single hair that curls over in your path. Taking a deep breath, you jump the tiny gap between you and the next biggest toe.
It’s a truly insignificant distance, no more than a couple of milimetres, yet to you the leap is fraught with danger, and you’re panting with exhaustion and exhileration as you land. Excitement, that’s why you set out here for spring break, and that’s why you chose this method. Danger.

Next it’s to the biggest toe of all, one wide enough for you to lie down on and rest. As you do so, you gaze upwards, wondering what Caitlyn’s mother must look like, past that cliff of denim. What thoughts run through her mind, and how surprised would she be by her daughter’s newest friend?

Rested enough, you return to jumping from toe to toe, speed increasing with your confidence. Every now and then you almost stumble upon landing, catching yourself clumsily between two skin cells, but you correct each time. Repeating the same route back and forth is great exercise, but should be having the desired effect upstairs…

First comes the movement beneath you, as the toes come to life, rearing up in sequence and throwing you to the carpet. Then comes a bellow from the heavens, a woman’s scream amplified to terrifying volumes.

“A mouse! Or a bug! Or something! Help!”

Your view of the two bare feet – each big enough to end you, if the giantess so wished – is snatched away as they fly skyward, no doubt to be clutched close by Caitlyn’s mother. You would look upward to observe them, but the menacing shape of big, black shoes belonging to the girl’s father are creeping into view at the corner of your eye…

Looking in the opposite direction, you can make out Caitlyn, an incredible distance away, across the aisle. Grinning, she’s on her knees, hands holding open the cavernous depths of her purse, a welcoming sanctuary. She hasn’t abandoned you at all!

You begin jogging toward her, still a little out of breath, when a new obstacle presents itself. The carpet fibres before you are cruelly flattened at fout points as titanic high-heeled shoes settle before you, the reassuring voice of a stewardess asking what the matter is.

If you dash between the woman’s legs to get to Caitlyn, she’ll probably see you! The alternative is to stay hiding out on this side of the ‘plane, where an official investigation into your presence is sure to begin any second now…
1212121111111111.title: Definite Danger

choices: Contact the stewardess
Experiment with sizes
12121211111111111.content:
Easy. You may be only an inch tall, but even you can cross the aisle to Caitlyn's waiting bag before the stewardess even looks down. So you immediately set to sprinting, aiming between the two enormous feet. This will be a piece of cake...

Suddenly, the outside world is replaced by a curved wall of white. You just manage to pull up short before you smack into it, and can hear a distant voice saying: "Don't worry madame, I have it."

You beat your fists ineffectively on the strong plastic surface, then jump back as something slides under the bottom edge of the wall, obscuring the carpet and nearly chopping at your feet until you jump up to land on it as it swiftly becomes the floor. It's too dark to see what it is, but now you recognise the technique that's been used to capture you...

You fall off your feet as the stewardess stands, what she thinks of as a bug trapped helplessly between a plastic cup and a sheet of paper. Since you're on an aeroplane, you can confidently rule out the possibility of her just winding down a window to throw you out, but she'll still have some horrible end planned for you, no doubt. You can imagine her tossing you into the toilet, or maybe just crushing you once she's alone...

Yeah, you need to avoid those things. Maybe you should call out to this giantess. It may incriminate you for smuggling yourself aboard the flight illegally, but that's better than dying, surely! Your other option would be to turn to the watch, and hope that science can save the day...
12121211111111111.title: Dashed Hopes

choices: The stewardess reaches for you now
The stewardess first escorts Caitlyn's parents to new seats
12121211111111112.content:
Yeah, you'rein no hurry to run out into the open. Instead, you dash back into the comforting shadows beneath the seat of Caitlyn's mother,and plan to wait for the fuss to die down. You can hear the stewardess assuring the woman that the flight is vermin free, yet the older lady insists that her seat be checked.

Great.

You watch as the stewardess places her feet opposite where you are hiding,and observe the rumbles through the flesh of her ankles as she clearly descends. Soon, fingers are pressing down carpet strands with incredible power, and light is snatched away as a beautiful face - tilted ninety-degrees, thirty feet across - takes a closer look at your hiding place.

You've never known terror like this. What is this woman going to do?
12121211111111112.title: Cowering Underfoot

choices: Change seats and go to the woman's low black heels further down the aisle.
Stay with Caitlyn's mother and try to get her attention.
12121211111112.content:
Your goal was to enjoy a nice flight and even though you're shrunk to a small size, you will enjoy this trip to Spring Break--forget Caitlyn's plan.

As you start to lean back against her mother's foot, you happen to notice something. There's another woman further down the aisle wearing black low heels and keeping her feet still (the foot you are currently on keeps shifting a bit). Maybe you could "change seats" and go to that lady for some much easier relaxation...but what if Caitlyn becomes suspicious and realizes you are gone. Even worse, what if the flight attendant comes by with the drink/snack cart and ends your life?


Something must be done soon...you came here to relax and be with someone that will help you on this flight, not do something that could cause you to get hurt.

What will you do?
12121211111112.title: Change Seats

choices: Sit out the flight amongst the hair
Start scrabbbling around, like a spider
1212121111112.content:
The hand opens, funneling to roll you down the slightly sweaty mass of skin to a radically different surface beneath. A springy mass of dark brown ropes, which you just manage to grab for support before careening downwards.

Looking up, you notice Caitlyn wink at you before turning away and progressing back to her seat. Well, looks like you've arrived.

Wait! Caitlyn wasn't that far above you as she departed! Which means that you're in a fairly elevated position, such as...

Pushing aside a few thick coils, you behold the wonder of a scalp beneath you. Caitlyn planted you on her mother's head, amongst her hair. She must want you to scurry around, like a bug, until her mother is irritated into wakefulness. Perhaps she hasn't thought far enough ahead to realise the potential consequences, namely that you'd be scratched to oblivion or else fall pretty far.

But maybe Caitlyn hasn't been thinking about you at all! Perhaps this is just a nasty prank she's pulling on her mother, and she has no care for the bug she's using at all! If that's the case, you could simply hide out here, pretty safe from most dangers, and allow this older giantess to take you to Spring Break instead.

But what if Caitlyn does care for you, and has an elaborate scheme to rescue you once her mother awakes? Perhaps you should go through with this plan after all...

Above all, try not to look down. It just wouldn't help.
1212121111112.title: A Head Full of Hair

choices: ontop of her ear
tip of her nose
sit on her necklace
12121211111121.content:
"You know what? Screw Caitlyn! She has the nerve to put me on her mother`s hair, with hopes that I get discovered, just to prank her?!
If her mother feel`s me scurrying around up here. Who knows how she`ll react! She could instantly lift up her hand and crush the life out of me! So forget Caityln!" you think to yourself.

You figure that you are small enough to remain undetected as long as you don`t move to frantically. And the hair is soft and warm, so your flight at the very least should be comfortable. You decide to bunch a few strands of hair together, which to you were as thick as broom sticks, and tie them around your waist to keep you from falling off her head and into certain death...or extreme pain.
Once secured, you lie down on your back and get yourself comfy. The only problem is that goddamn overhead light is shining directly in your face, you flip over onto your side, you were now looking along the side of her head. It was like looking into a field of TALL grass, her scalp was semi visible but her silky soft hair seemed to take up most of of your view, no matter where you looked.
Your honored host was fast asleep, her light breathing helped sooth you, until you finally start to rest your eyes and fall asleep.

You were in the middle of a pleasant dream, when a loud "ACHOO!" startled you back to conciseness, as well as your host it would seem, as you could feel the momentum of her turning and moving her head. You slowly sit up, and stretch your arms and back until you feel limbered up. You slowly rise to your feet, you push aside a few strands of her hair and wipe the crust from your eyes, then check your watch, you`ve been asleep for a while it seems. Miami shouldn`t be far now. Might as well see what your gracious host is doing to pass the time, as from the snoring.. you can tell her husband is asleep. You unfasten her hair from your waist and lightly walk towards her hairline, while carefully pushing aside the strands in your path.

Upon reaching the edge of her forehead, you look down and notice she is reading one of your favourite books on her Kindle, "A Song of Ice and Fire." You notice her progress is a few pages from where you currently are. You are are about to sit down and join her in reading when you remember... Caitlyn hasn`t heard her mother scream about anything, which she knows means her mother hasn`t noticed me in her hair yet. And if she hasn`t checked on me while me and her mother were asleep, then she could be coming any second to see what`s up. You decide that being up here was no longer in your best interest for now. But so far, this woman has been
a delightful giantess to hide on, she doesn`t fidget or move around to much, so you didn`t want to leave her until your in Miami. Plus you really wanted to read the rest of the book.

So you decide to find another part of her to travel to, where you can get a good view of the Kindle.
You decide...
12121211111121.title: Sit out the flight amongst the hair

choices: You descend to her ear
You go for the nose
12121211111122.content:
The scalp is a sensitive part of the human body. It shouldn't take much work on the part of your inch-tall self to cause enough irritation for Caitlyn's mother to wake up. Not much at all.

You hope.

Dropping to all fours, you crawl around, being careful to dig your fingers in as far as you can. The skin is surprisingly resilient before your pathetic attck though, and you're not sure if you're having much effect.

No sooner should you entertain this thought however, than the surface beneath you shifts a few degrees to one side, causing you to overbalance and fall. Just the woman shifting in her sleep, you presume. Clearly, it will take a little more to bring her to her senses.

There must be another part of her, within easy reach of these rope-like hair strands, that you can irritate more effectively.
12121211111122.title: Spider-mite

choices: The woman moves her head to rest it on her hand - you in-between!
The woman's husband notices you and bats you off
121212111111221.content:
Your inch-tall form doesn't weigh much; the otherwise flimsy strands of this woman's hair will more than bear it. Still, you tug a few times just to be sure before beginning your abseil, and spare a thought for the reason why you're doing this: Caitlyn.

Then it's down, your intended route quickly becoming a desperate shimmy, ripping skin from your palms as you zip downward. The ear comes up pretty soon, a warped tunnel of flesh that doesn't look too inviting. Still, it's shouting that will get this woman's attention. You just need to get this hair swinging toward that dark opening...

Now, your miniscule weight works against you,as the hairs stubbornly refuse to budge, even a little. You are left dangling in space.
121212111111221.title: Ear

choices: Caitlyn intends to use you as a deterrant, just as you thought
Caitlyn intends to hand you over to them as a new distraction
121212111112.content:
"Awesome!" Caitlyn gushes, smile once more eating up the sky. "This is gonna be soooo cool!"

Her other hand snatches up the purse again, while you are wrapped up within the warm, only slightly stifling confines of Caitlyn's fist, held secure, safe and hidden. Flesh pulses all around you, and comfort isn't far from your mind. The world shakes all about as your giantess friend (you hope) walks, but you are cushioned against all buffets and bashes by her tremendous musculature, and you begin to relax.

As you do so, you wonder how exactly Caitlyn intends to use you as a disciplinary tool. Brandish you before her siblings, and claim that the same will happen to them if they don't buck up their ideas? Regardless, smothered in the loving embrace of the giantess, you find yourself beginning to not care.

All too soon, you are deposited at your destination...
121212111112.title: Discipline At Any Cost

choices: "I'm tellin' mom!" the boy shouts
The girl begins crying VERY loudly
1212121111121.content:
The fingers uncurl in time, leaving you blinking at the newly-revealed light in Caitlyn's palm. It's not long before you're trembling in fear at the sight of her siblings as well.

They cease whatever dispute they were engaged in as you are displayed before them. The larger one is the boy, a young lad of perhaps eight or nine, with short blonde hair and a sour expression on his humungous face. You should not be scared of someone so young, you know this, yet when his darting eyes are the size of you, and his grubby mitts could happily squeeze the life from you, you can't help it.

Your unprecedented terror before the boy is as nothing towards the utterly embarassing reaction to the girl. Probably not more than four years of age, her dumb attention is captivated by you, her eyes glittering behind the unruly mass of curly hair that crowns her head. At any moment you anticipate her reaching up her mighty arm to make a grab for you, and the thought of meeting your end in the embrace of something so unthinking vibrates a shudder through you, your legs barely supporting you as you endeavour to remain standing and not show fear in the face of these two young giants. That would be all they needed to take and abuse your tiny body. Resolve, showing bravery appropriate to your adult bearing, should keep them in check.

Of course, that all depends on what Caitlyn plans. "Whatcha got there, Cait?" the boy asks, his crude force blasted out with such intense volume and powerful breath that you quail.

"Oh, this?" the teen holding you says, almost casually. "This is just some guy that pissed me off. I shrunk him. And if either of you two bothers me for the rest of this flight, I'm gonna do the same to you."

Now the two faces that evoked such terror in you display fear of their own, and you are emboldened a tad. Caitlyn's plan actually worked! But what happens now, you wonder?
1212121111121.title: Deterrant

choices: Rely on Caitlyn's mind
Abandon ship
12121211111212.content:
The girl's mouth opens, and your world closes under the torrent of noise that issues forth. You fall to your knees in Caitlyn's palm, and can only imagine that strange looks that this scene is getting from around the plane's passengers. You hope that Caitlyn has a plan for handling this, or else is a quick enough thinker to deal with it.

If not - well, maybe you should abandon these people and hide until this dies down.
12121211111212.title: Tears Before Bedtime

choices: ...the boy
...the girl
1212121111122.content:
The fingers uncurl in time, leaving you blinking at the newly-revealed light in Caitlyn's palm. It's not long before you're trembling in fear at the sight of her siblings as well.

They cease whatever dispute they were engaged in as you are displayed before them. The larger one is the boy, a young lad of perhaps eight or nine, with short blonde hair and a sour expression on his humungous face. You should not be scared of someone so young, you know this, yet when his darting eyes are the size of you, and his grubby mitts could happily squeeze the life from you, you can't help it.

Your unprecedented terror before the boy is as nothing towards the utterly embarassing reaction to the girl. Probably not more than four years of age, her dumb attention is captivated by you, her eyes glittering behind the unruly mass of curly hair that crowns her head. At any moment you anticipate her reaching up her mighty arm to make a grab for you, and the thought of meeting your end in the embrace of something so unthinking vibrates a shudder through you, your legs barely supporting you as you endeavour to remain standing and not show fear in the face of these two young giants. That would be all they needed to take and abuse your tiny body. Resolve, showing bravery appropriate to your adult bearing, should keep them in check.

Of course, that all depends on what Caitlyn plans. "Whatcha got there, Cait?" the boy asks, his crude force blasted out with such intense volume and powerful breath that you quail.

"A new toy for ya, Billy," she smiles in reply, and your terror is reborn as the giants' eyes widen, his mouth following suit to display a developing yet still destructive set of teeth.

There's an explosion and you throw yourself flat. When the boy laughs (his voice reverberating throughout your skull) you look up to see that it had only been the girl clapping her hands in glee, the simple movements of a child akin to a bomb to you now. She notices your reaction as well, and bounces in her seat, giggling.

Your attempts to be brave have failed. Now you're powerless before them.

"You'll have to learn to share," Caitlyn announces, handing you off to...
1212121111122.title: New Toy

choices: Escape
Wait it out
12121211111221.content:
The giant boy immediately snags your minuscule form, twisting you around in his enormous hands, treating you with less care than animal and more like a cheap plastic toy. Its first nauseating and then painful as he swings you upside down to hold you by just your ankle. You had to escape.

As if to help, the gigantic girl next to the boy reached over to try and steal you away. You'd rather go to neither of them, but they had size, strength and currently control of you. Your present capture twisted to kick the girl, his barefoot abandoning a sandal on the ground. While he did it, you could tell a mischievious idea had formed. Save the toy for later but keep it from sister's hands.Turning you saw the girl wanted nothing to do with his feet, backing away as much as she could to avoid the foot. It was covered in dirt, but at least it was just inches to her.

To your horror, the boy's foot comes to his knee and you see it getting closer as the fingers holding you close in on it. There's black dirt and specks of debris from where the boy's been coating it along with a layer of sweat.In seconds, your tiny body is pressed against the enormous foot with your head and arms between the larger of the middle toes. In an instant the sweat had soaked your front through to the skin. The giant's skin felt warm and smooth to you, despite that the grooves in the skin were large enough to get a fist between them. The odor though, wasn't as positive, nor was your site with giant wads of goop lining the skin in your vision.

Before you could try and escape, an enormous weight came against your back, with a lot of work you turn your head to see its the boy's flip-flop. His titanic toes wiggle as he slips it into place, the half-inch tall structures nearly crushing your head. Your next sensation is of being pulled towards the flip-flop, but stuck in place along with a sensation of fast motion. The instant it passes, the crushing weight of the boy's foot comes down on you and its not even taking the force of his body, its like being pinned under a military tank. All you were saved by was the plyability of the skin and fatty flesh underneath.

Before the plane-ride, this was a little boy and everything about him was little to you. No weight, no strength, no height. Now he was just enormous and dwarfed you in every way. Full-size you could've beat the snot out of him, at an inch tall to him, he could make a blood stain out of you with just a toe.
12121211111221.title: Tortured Toy

choices: Go to shoes
Stay here or run for edg
121212111112211.content:
The kid's foot was gonna kill you. Just the weight of the foot sitting their on the ground was all it took to crush you, it was tons. This was how foot-prints were imprinted in these, mega-tons of weight shoving down. How toys could survive this kind of torture, you didn't know, but you did know that you couldn't. The only way out though, was to get smaller.

You fought against the tight spaces and got your watch up to where it could actually be seen and began to adjust the settings. When at last it was set, you slam the button down and immediately your wold pushes out. As your shrinking, you notice that your feet feel wet, when at last your free of the foot's weight, you find your shoes and socks were snagged on something farther back. Your microscopic feet slipped out and were pulled with you, everything biological would be, but the shoes weren't a physical part of your body and didn't come with.

In the end, there you stood, so small a bug probably wouldn't even bother chasing you for a snack, might not even be able to see you for that matter. The walls around you which the boy saw as a half-inch had been up to your waist earlier, now the titan toes towered overhead far into the range of miles, you were not so unsure that an inch-tall human wouldn't have miles of toes. You were certain though that you'd never seen anything bigger than this or even capable of offering up a challenge to it.

A sudden series of what you can only call Kid quakes rocks the flip-flops, the mass of muscles overhead as large as any tectonic plate. You were thrown to the ground and nearly fell into what you could only call a sink hole, one of the billions of holes in the foam flip-flops, it was enormously wide and infinitely deep. You held on and eventually the quake ended. In the far off distance, you saw a pair of enormous black objects, your shoes. It was a challenge to see across these enormous holes, and often, you could not, but from the looks of things, those shoe laces dwarfed many of them as a gigantic bridge.

Concretely this settled that even to something an inch tall, you were a speck almost too tiny to see. That spoke measures about how big this kid was. You hadn't quite escaped yet, two of his titan toes composed your world until you got out of there or he managed to throw you out. Of course, weighing less than a speck of dust, throwing you wouldn't be hard.
121212111112211.title: Escape

choices: Science
Intervention
1212121111122112.content:
You were staying put, not a thing was going to move you from your spot and that was firmly that. Eventually something would give you a good chance to escape and that was when you'd leave this spot. The kid'd take the flip-flops off or something and you'd get away somehow. That was the master plan, wait and make one when the time was right.

The chance however, never comes. Your suddenly pinned against the foam and then sent hurtling into a mountain to your side underforces not even astronauts endure. Somehow though your conciousness stays and you live to see the color beyond your view blur and distort under the movement in speeds far in excess of sound. When at last it stops, you find yourself in a few miles deep valley stretching out of sight and appearing to curve in the distance. To your horror, you realize its a single groove of a foot-print, specifically at the toes. You can't see the flip-flop's sole from here, so there's no telling where your shoes went, not that you'd be wearing them anytime soon.

Here, you decide to try and figure a scale of things, more or less for the hell of it. In the end, you conclude that a single milimeter is 30 miles, every inch 750 miles, the boys foot 5000 miles and his whole body upwards of 30,000 miles, looking around 35,000 but it was hard to tell as you didn't have his exact height. To scale that put him at almost 5 times the size of the Earth if you went only by height. With a sudden look around, you realized you were on a whole world with its own biosphere and more, even nanoscale life held on by the massive kid's gravity.

Looking around, you noticed wonders never before seen. There were clouds or structures like them near the skin, dinosaur like animals and plants along with some that didn't fit either categorie. This was a whole new field of science! What might other people and creatures carry!
1212121111122112.title: Side's up

choices: Stay here (shrink to get in a cave, not be sucked off)
See the girl (leg go, float up)
12121211111221122.content:
The plan for you had been to stay put and keep to yourself until there was a good chance of escape. In the mean time was to examine all the new science around you, a whole new field, discovered by you. It guaranteed a great deal to your future if you lived through this. That though, would be the hard part, along with explaining to the world how you wound up on a boy's foot and this small.

There however, is no time for science of any sort. The sky overhead goes dark and beyond the world turns to a blur of colors. Kid, or perhaps earthquakes, whatever you'd call them filled the area as muscles that could cover the planet began to twitch and move thousands of miles. The air all around drew upward like a tornado, but one everywhere at once, a vacuum. Quickly you grab the nearest tree-like object as the force from above begins to win a war with gravity.

Unknown to you, another planetary body is in search of a toy to play with. The girl wants that two inch doll her brother's got and has at last over-come her fear of feet. One enormous hand wrapped the big toe you were one, its greater size beat the gravity of the more moon-like toes. She was working to keep from getting kicked, keep the foot as far from her as possible and reach past the foot with another hand to grab a not-there you. The boy had his hands pre-occupied with a game he couldn't stop now and was trying to pull his prize away from the girl.

Meanwhile, between these two titans, your holding onto a tree-thing for all you can, the very existance of the hand above a massive force to you. Yea, 'big' college kid you were and these two kids towered over you like a planet before even reaching their knees and they controlled your fate for now in a battle of forces and gravity that well might as well have you in at a weight of absolute zero.

Who would you go to?
12121211111221122.title: Moving up

choices: Grow and run for it
Effects of tiny size
121212111112211221.content:
At this point, your hanging on the tree, legs facing the sky. On the brighter side, you've got yourself pulled down pretty close to the ground. The girl may well be a better choice, but it was more dangerous on a hand and you'd either reach terminal velocity until you landed or it'd take to long and you'd end up in a free fall to whichever object had the greatest effect on you, a distance measured in billions of miles.

Hanging there, you needed an idea and actually got one. The soil here was dense and held very tightly to the titanous toes, it wasn't giving way to the gravity, all it gave to were your footprints. Pulling closer, you saw that this dirt was also porus, it had what you could use for caves beneath its surface. So long as the soil didn't get sucked up, you would be fine there. Admittedly though, you didn't look forward to being any smaller.

Pulling yourself as close to a footprint as you could, you anchored down and adjusted the watch, then keyed in the shrink. As everything just got bigger, you pulled yourself along the tree and then to the footprint and the upper most caves. At first you were too big and barely able to get a finger in the micro-pores. Eventually you fit in though, a cave which had been an milimeter was now a mile. You were 1/274560th of your former size, the 'kid' you were on stretched, well, to put it simply, his little toe dwarfed the sun on your scale. He could sit on Earth's orbit, reach the sun and squash it between his toes and probably barely feel a thing.

Welcome to a world so small its not even named. Where every kid's a solarsystem just by the mass of their feet and their body a great many star systems.
121212111112211221.title: Stay here (shrink to get in a cave, not be suck...

choices: Press the clone button.
Explore your new world.
1212121111122112212.content:
Somehow, the idea of living on this little boy's body didn't seem so bad. You had lost all your clothes, but now that the device had affected you so much, you no longer needed food or water to survive, and your body was invulnerable to any crushing or cutting damage. The smell of his incomprehensibly titanic body isn't nearly as bad as you'd imagine.

You wonder what other parts of your new world look like, and consider going to explore, since your tiny size means the girl's hand will never get close enough to even graze you. However, your attention is drawn to a blinking button on the device, and you remember the clone button you'd created. Since you had the ability to remove mass, the device stored some of that mass and could use it to create copies of you.
1212121111122112212.title: Effects of tiny size

choices: The  Girl
Drop
121212111112211222.content:
This boy was out to get you, staying was a bad idea. If he ever discovered your presence it would not end well, and it wouldn't anyway as you couldn't survive here, as soon as he ran in the ran or he mud you were done for. He'd perhaps jump in a puddle and splash around the water holding to his skin would be on the level of oceans, to either crush you under pressure or drown you, ether was not a good thing.

You let go and floated upwards, crossing hundreds of miles. Then it became a torrent of winds and forces as the boy fought against his sister now, believing you were still underfoot and trying to keep you captive. The planet's gravities pulled you all over across open space..
121212111112211222.title: War of Planets

choices: Adventures in the nanoworld
Arrival
1212121111122112222.content:
The titans fought, eventually the boy's hands got into the mix, then his feet and the girl's feet. They kicked and hit each other while you floated in between, pulled this way and that by the gravity of both of them. The flip-flops fell off, but the tiny captive was forgotten for now. In the air then, tens of thousands of miles from anything you floated, the massive beings beyond gigantic blurs.

Land suddenly came up, though your not sure who's it was. It blasted wind to light speed, it caught you and shot you downward before gravity could take hold. Flying to the ground, the majority of the tussel was soon overhead and massive structures blew by. Below a huge chasm opened up and that was the last you saw before landing. Luckily, you lived through it.

From overhead, light beamed in, it was dim but all you could see by. It was the boy's backpack, you could see toys hundreds of miles tall, even to the smallest action figure you were a speck. Even in this nano world there was still life though. For now, you avoided the toys, sticking to the clothe, like webs and forests. There you examined all the life you saw. It was your hope that the boy was more interested in toys than whatever clothe continent you were on.
1212121111122112222.title: Drop

choices: Wow... BIG dino's....
A few inches... Mini-raptors = rex
12121211111221122221.content:
Hours faded into history as you examined every plant you came across; trees, flowers and more, all living in various dirts for soil. It was amazing to find trees which would be put under total darkness just by a new plant started growing. There you just went from tree to plant, learning whatever you could from it.

After a while, it turned into a real adventure. A pack of raptors found you and was after a snack. You ran for all your worth to escape but they were faster. The thought of growth had crossed your mind but if you went too much the boy could find you. Losing ground and fast, you headed for a group of the mini-raptors, the ankle biters of dinosaurs. Once you were in the crowd, you slammed down the shrink button.

The world shot away...
12121211111221122221.title: Adventures in the nanoworld

choices: The girl gets the shoe off, and they begin to fight over you.
The boy and girl end up killing you, and Caitlin will have to watch over them.
121212111112212.content:
The little girl, who had apparently overcame her fear of feet, slowly crawled over to your position. The boy, distracted by his hand held video game, doesn't notice her ninja like skills. You, on the hand, can't see anything else. She reaches her hand down, and grabs at his big toe, trying to pry you free. This gets the boy's attention.
         "HEY! It's mine!" Reduced to nothing but a pronoun, you are swung back and forth as the boy attempts to shake his sister off his foot, all while trying to finish his game. For the boy, this is annoying. For the girl, it's disgusting. For you, it is nearly fatal. The boy squeezes his toes on you, trying to get a hold, but almost crushing your skull in the process. The girl, meanwhile, has given up on the toes, and was trying to pull the flip-flop off, grating you on the dirt on the sole. You peek out, trying to get a hold on the situation, and see Caitlin across the aisle, barely covering her laughs. That bitch. You trusted her, and now you're nearly dead.
121212111112212.title: Time to fight

choices: Caitlyn hands you to a stewardess
Another passenger makes a grab for you
12121211112.content:
Her face creases in places, and you swing your head from side to side to take in her whole expression. Crap; that's a frown.

"Think that's clever, do you?" Caitlin whispers, although the volume of her voice still resonates wildly through your bones. "Cheating these hard-working people out of their due? I think that you'd better turn yourself in, little guy."

You try to protest, but then a finger and thumb pinch you cruelly from behind, squeezing the air out of your lungs and hoisting you well above her head height. Don't look down, don't look down...

Caitlin begins walking out of the rest-room, your inch-tall form spinning ever so slightly from her grip. At the end of the aisle, you can see her target: a statuesque stewardess who is currently checking a passenger's seatbelt. The punk intends to hand you over to the authorities!

It's a slow walk, and as you twist in the breeze you can see that the passenegers aren't oblivious to you. A few turn in their seats to look as Caitlin passes, and the scrutiny of their awesome eyes is very scary. Kids, teenagers, young adults and the elderly, giants of all types glance briefly in your direction, and you feel even smaller than you actually are, embarasses and terrified all at once.

This couldn't get any worse...
12121211112.title: Off to see a Stewardess

choices: The stewardess 'imprisons' you for the duration of the flight
The stewardess wants to know more about you
121212111121.content:
"I caught a stowaway," Caitlyn proudly announces.

Dangling above her head from her finger and thumb, you get a perfect view of the back of the stewardess' head, long blonde hair brought up in a bun beneath her blue hat, matching the uniform below. Not that you want to spend too much time looking down from this ungodly height...

"And where did you find... him..."

The stewardsess trails off as, once she's turned around, her eyes alight upon you. Those eyes - big and brown and wide with shock - are but one contributing factor to the image of beauty that she presents before you, writ large across a canvas that encompasses the horizon. Somewhere in her mid-twenties, with a perfect nose and luscious lips currently widened around a gasping mouth, she's quite something.

And quite possibly the face of your executioner.

"Around," Caitlyn shrugs, bringing you in lower, seemingly towards the stewardess' blazered breasts. No, towards the cupped hands that await slightly below. The pressure is released upon you, and you fall, impacting mercifully lightly against unyielding flesh and bone, which manages somehow to flinch upon your impact, rolling you around the palm. Now you experience a hand soft due not to the youth of Caitlyn, but clearly a rigorous regime of moisturiser.

You are too dazed to register the treacherous punk's departure, but can hear the stewardess mumbling something about Donna covering for her before hustling away, rolling you about even more in her hands. You wonder what she's going to do with you.
121212111121.title: Caitlyn Hands You To A Stewardess

choices: Grow big enough to get out
Stay here until you're wanted
1212121111211.content:
She's talking to herself. That's what you conclude, anyway. None of the things she's saying seem to be directed your way, at any rate.

"I can't deal with this right now," she says. "Tiny little stowaways? I don't think so. We'll just find somewhere to keep it for now, that's all. Now where..?"

All this she says - her voice rolling down to you from the heavens - while she walks along, your view of the scenery she passes obscured by the gigantic fingers curled around you. The warm embrace is comforting, but the muttering is just worrisome.

"There."

And with that pronouncement, you are sent rolling down a palm that has suddenly moved ninety degrees, into a steep-sided coffee mug. Thankfully, it's empty.

Looking upward, you can see nothing but the ceiling. The stewardess isn't even looking down to check on you! Are you that small a concern to her?

Your prison shudders - presumably she's placed it down on a surface. As you thrill to the distant impacts of her walking away, you scrabble at the curved sides of the mug. No good - you can't gain purchase there.

Of course, with your size-alteration device, escaping from this place would be easy. Tempting as it is though, would it perhaps be worth it to wait here until the stewardess shows interest in you again?
1212121111211.title: Imprisoned!

choices: Shrink out of sight
Grow to regular size and confront them
12121211112111.content:
Too big and you'll smash the cup, so you settle for a manageable six inch height. It's a simple stride over the edge of the mug, and then you're on the counter-top. A few other items of crockery and cutlery lie around, and it's impeccably clean. There's not too much time to explore however, as you can hear people coming - you recognise the voice of the stewardess, talking to other people about not believing what they're about to see.

Do you really want to be here when they arrive?
12121211112111.title: Going Up

choices: Claim to be an undercover inspector for the company
Claim to be an engineer that got stuck on the plane on takeoff
121212111121112.content:
Time to make a bluff check.

You undo the shrinking with a simple twist of the watch, then slide from the counter top to stand before the stewardesses as they enter the room. They - both rather attractive, you must admit - gasp at seeing you. You will have a few moments to impress them before they recover their wits.

You're dressed fairly casually, and carrying a backpack with clothes and provisions, so you'll have to choose a convincing cover story. They probably won't accept any claim to be the owner of the airline, for example.
121212111121112.title: Act Casual

choices: You tell the truth
You lie
1212121111212.content:
"So," the woman's terrible voice echoes down from on high, "how'd you do this to yourself, huh? How'd you shrink yourself so small?"

Hah. You've been through this before. Telling Caitlyn the truth was a mistake, so surely it'll be that much worse to admit your scheme to an official working for the airline.

You can spin a lie. Play on her sympathies. Tell her that you've been shrunk against your will...
1212121111212.title: Fool Me Twice

choices: Point out a Mad Looking Scientist Type
Ask to be protected
12121211112122.content:
"I didn't," you say. "I was shrunk against my will, brought here by some evil scientist!"

The stewardess's eyes widen even further, and a loud gasp emerges from her mouth-cavern. "Who? Who did this to you?"

This would be a chance to get back at Caitlyn, but she's hardly believable as a mad scientist-type. Too young, anyway. You can barely see past the cupped fingers of the woman's hand, but you're sure that you could find a likely scapegoat if you asked her to take you around in order to point out your 'captor'. Then again, given that you seem to have gotten her sympathy, you could cry off that you'retoo scared to point the guy out, and just want her to protect you. You may make it to spring break after all...
12121211112122.title: Victimised

choices: She feels sorry for you, and wants to help
She's crazy, and thinks she's responsible
1212121112.content:
"I was hoping you could tell me," you say, hoping that you've got the right mix of hesitancy and desperation in your tone of voice. "I... I just woke up like this, and hid in your bag to avoid getting stepped on."

Your head is down, but through one eye you look up at Caitlyn's monstrous form, hoping for a flicker of sympathy...
1212121112.title: Lies

choices: You'll brave her bag and potential sibling abuse
You'll boldly wait alone in the restroom, avoiding other passengers
12121211121.content:
You can't believe that she's almost welling up at the pack of lies that you told her! Oh wait, that's a very tiny tear in her eye, it just seems huge to your small stature.

"You must be so scared!" Caitlyn says. "And now I've taken you onto this plane, away from your friends and family..!"

She closes her eyes and turns her head away, and you make your best effort at loud, calming noises. "Don't blame yourself," you say.

"But it is my fault!" she retorts. "I'll make it up to you, somehow! I'll help you get back to normal, I promise!"

As she opens her eyes again, and you see your form reflected in them, you know that she's speaking truthfully. Whatever did you do to deserve such a friedn in your situation?

Caitlyn clenches her jaw tight, revealing again those monstrous teeth. "Oh! But I've got to look after my kid brother and sister on this trip, and it would be very dangerous if they got their hands on you! Once we arrive I can keep you away from them, but on this flight there's not a lot I can do. You can hide in my bag if you want, but I can't guarantee your safety - they do have a habit of pawing through everything!"

You can handle that, you reckon, but Caitlyn doesn't seem too confident.

"Perhaps I should leave you here, in the restroom! I swear that I'll come back for you at the end of the flight, but it must be safer here than with me at the moment! Oh, I'm sorry, so sorry!"

Now she genuinely is welling up, the torrent of salty water cascading from her eyes moving you to make a decision.
12121211121.title: Help

choices: One of Caitlyn's siblings gets her bag away from her
The 'plane experiences some turbulance
121212111211.content:
"No," you say, standing as tall as you can, "I'll be fine in your bag. Thank you for helping me, Caitlyn."

She smiles, then nearly chokes, then holds a hand (the other hand, of course) to her mouth. Saying nothing, she lowers you back into her bag, zipping it up and carrying you away.

Some emotions are too much for words. This girl clearly cares deeply for you already, and you're just stringing her along as a mule. Perhaps that sickness you feel is a twinge of guilt. She doesn't deserve what you're doing to her, and you don't deserve her...
121212111211.title: You'll Brave Her Bag

choices: You are awoken by her brother rifling through the bag
Her sister tries to steal her lipstick
1212121112111.content:
The darkness is calm. You've become accustomed to exactly where each outsized possession of Caitlyn's lies in this bag now, so there is no danger from them tumbling around on her journey back to her seat.

So safe do you feel, you actually allow yourself to fall asleep...
1212121112111.title: One of Caitlyn's siblings gets her bag away...

choices: Stay still and hope she hasn't seen you
Run to get away
12121211121112.content:
The bludgeoning of a great hand wakens you, and even as you open your eyes you don't have any time to register where exactly it is as an unyielding mass of flesh and bone batters you carelessly. Noise joins in soon enough, and despite your bruising you can make out Caitlyn's voice demanding that someone give it back, give it back, give it back --

Your world spins away from you, a clash between siblings having knocked your bagly hideaway loose from its position. You presume that's the ground you crash into, as you tumble loose from your surroundings to hear the squealing of Caitlyn's younger sister above you. Has she spotted you? Or are you safe, with only movement giving away your position?
12121211121112.title: A Little Lippy

choices: Shout up to show your appreciation
Settle down for a rest
1212121112112.content:
She's a means to an end, you tell yourself. This girl gets you to your destination, you thank her, you leave her to go party. She's young; she'll move on easily, forget all about you. Your smile lacks triumph.

Things begin to shake all around you; what is that girl doing? The clutter around the bag is tumbling and rolling all around, and your feet go from under you in the dark. Above the noise of the cavalcade comes agitation from the giant world outside, passengers raising their voices in confusion and alarm.

"Don't worry," one voice intones, low and cutting through the chatter, directed at you alone. "You're safe."

It comes from above, and looking up at the bag's zip you can see light at the edges of its opening, silhouetting the immense mouth that is pressed into the gap, Caitlyn's breath misting down at you. "I'm here," she says. "Nothing will hurt you."

Well, that makes everything better, doesn't it?
1212121112112.title: Turbulance

choices: The next people in are a couple looking to join the mile-high club
The next person in is the businesswoman you saw earlier
121212111212.content:
"Don't worry about me, babe," you reassure her. "I can wait it out here."

With her answering look, you're afraid that your casual use of the word 'babe' may have offended her, but then you see that it's again nothing more than concern. For you.

"But who knows what people may come in here? What they'd do to you if they found you?"

"Ah, see, there's the point. If they find me. I just won't get found. And I think I may just be small enough to pull that trick off."

Caitlyn smiles finally, although tears still prick her eyes, and she brings you to her mouth for one final kiss - her lips all-encompassing, threatening to engulf you - that leaves you in no doubt as to her feelings for you. Or yours for her.

You bound off her hand once she's lowered it, and wave farewell as she rises to her full, skyscraper height above you and her legs - clad in bright, striped stockings - bear her out of the restroom at incredible speed.

That leaves you alone to find a hiding place before one of the other passengers answers a call of nature. As you scamper toward room's corner, you wonder who it could be, trying to distract yourself from thinking about the teenage punk that seems so concerned about you. Caitlyn is, after all, merely a means to an end - you'll use her to get to Spring Break, then abandon her. But that doesn't mean that you're looking forward to hurting her, after deceiving her and getting her to believe in you so much.

Poor kid.
121212111212.title: Morals

choices: Switch to the college girl
Stay with the businesswoman
1212121112122.content:
You wait for a few minutes until the door opens. In comes the businesswoman from before. You conclude she is your next best carrier.

She walks in, hovers over you, walks over to the mirrors, and begins to apply make-up. You climb unto her shoe, a black business high heel waiting for her to finish. Once done she walks back to her seat, the beginning of a roller coaster ride for you. She sits down and is sitting in the middle aisle right next to a cute college girl that you didn't see before. Her head is tilted back as she is fast asleep. You get a little excited: maybe she's going to a party too. What do you do? Do you stay with this businesswoman or switch carriers? Maybe, this knew person will take you to where the action is.
1212121112122.title: Person from before

choices: Shrink out of sight
Regrow to normal
12121211122.content:
No, that's definitely a smile on Caitlyn's face...

"Awesome," she breathes, hot air washing over you and bringing with it the mild scent of fresh meat. "It worked."

"It... worked?" you ask, looking up as you step forward, one hand instinctively going for the watch on your wrist.

Caitlyn's mouth slides into a one-sided smirk, her eyelids narrowing her eyes. "Take a look behind you, little guy."

You look back at her index finger, and the silver celtic ring that -

"That's right. I'm a witch," Caitlyn crows triumphantly. "I almost can't believe that my spell worked! I wanted a little companion to keep me company on this trip, and I got one! You'd better hope that I'm in a kind mood, buddy!"

Great. Stuck with loony tunes here, your trip won't be as fun as you'd imagined. You have just one advantage: the actual device that shrank you. It's clear that you don't want to be around a crazy wannabe witch for too long, so you should use the amchine to get yourself out of this situation.

Option A involves decreasing your size even more, shrinking so small that Caitlyn can't even see you and then escaping, maybe getting a little bigger once she's gone and finding someone else to tag along with. Someone with sanity. Good in the long term, but the immediate dangers of being crushed at first are pretty great.

Option B involves restoring yourself to normal size, and putting this girl straight on what's what. You didn't want to have to do it except in the most extreme of situations, but you think that this one qualifies.

What's it to be?
12121211122.title: She's Crazy!

choices: Caitlyn washes her hands of you - literally
Caitlyn actually IS a witch - and knows exactly where you are!
121212111221.content:
"No!" Caitlyn wails, deafeningly loud, "Stop! I command you to stop at once!"

Adios, crazy lady, you think to yourself as the woman above and around you becomes less of a giantess and more of a landmass. The welcoming valleys located in her palmprint are an excellent place to hide from her, and the goings-on of the outside world are of no concern to someone unable to affect or be affected by them.

Her blaring noise is beyond your range to even register now, and with the sharp canyon walls of her skin strecthing up a few hundred feet you figure it's safe to stop shrinking now. You don't want to contemplate working out just how small you are, though.

Theoretically, she should be unable to harm you now. Shaking her hand around, turning it upside down, clenching her fist - mere changes in the landscape to you now, and ones to which you can easily adapt.

You begin walking for no more reason than as something to do, thrilling to the pulsing rhythm of blood far, far beneath the surface, gushing through to transfer life to every quarter of this goddess whose surface you now walk upon.

Of course, you shouldn't get too carried away here, as you don't want to remain in this valley forever. It's just a temporary measure, somewhere to shelter until it's safe to leave and go elsewhere. Question is, how can you tell when that is?

And growing again would put you immediately into Caitlyn's clutches, not something you'd want to return to any time soon. One would think that you've merely postponed your danger, rather than averting it.

But science will prevail! Science always finds a way. You just need to trust that some inspiration will strike you.
121212111221.title: Out of Sight

choices: You beg for her mercy,and to be restored to normal size
In a panic, you attempt to escape
1212121112212.content:
"Oh, simple man of science..." a voice purrs in your head. Caitlyn's voice. "You cannot escape me that easily."

You blink, and then you're in her palm again, an inch tall. She smiles down at you, and you reach for your watch again.

"Looking for this?" she asks, pinching the device between thumb and forefinger of her other hand. You can only gasp as she hefts her mouth wide and tosses your only hope of salvation down her throat. "Now, I believe that you had something to say to me?"
1212121112212.title: Burn the Witch!

choices: You shrink back down
Something's wrong - either it doesn't work, or it's too slow
121212111222.content:
Caitlyn's eyes widen as you begin to expand, and she's too paralysed with surprise to react; fortunate for you, as she still could have crushed you when you were just beginning, but now - as you jump off her hand to land, full-sized before her - she can't stop you.

It is a bit of a squeeze in the restroom though, and at these close confines it really hurts when Caitlyn screams.

"Help!" she shouts, running out. "There's a man in the restroom! He's a stowaway! I think he might be a terrorist!"

See, that'd be one of the reasons that you didn't want to resize without good reason. This could be it for you, if you don't shrink back down before anyone arrives. Simple, really...
121212111222.title: Terrorist?

choices: You tell a long and rambling story about how you got there
As you are fingering your watch, one guard thinks you've got a bomb
1212121112222.content:
It's... not working.

You flash a terrified grin up at the security personnel standing at the open doorway, both of them more than prepared for trouble. Of course, at least you can rest easy in the knowledge that they can't exactly tell you to get off - no, it'll be a nice cosy cell within earshot of spring break that you'll enjoy.

"What are you doing?" one of them asks, his hand resting easy on a baton.

Your mind rolls over the possibilities in your head, hoping that the device is merely powering up or something, and that you'll be able to escape in time - just so long as they don't confiscate your watch! Yeah, you just need to stall, that's it!
1212121112222.title: Explanations

choices: You are dragged away and the plane continues to its original destination
The captain decides to hear you out, and comes in for a landing
12121211122222.content:
Your fingers wander again to the button of the machine at your wrist, and one of the guards acts instinctively, pointing his gun to your forehead.

"Hand me the watch. Now."

You do as you are told, all the while watching the second security man, who is talking rather into a walkie-talkie in a rather concerned manner. As you finally relinquish ownership of the shrinking device, he ceases his communication and turns to you, seriousness writ large over his bland face.

"You're going to have to come with us, sir."

It is an embarrassing trip through the aisles of the plane up to the cockpit and crew section, and you feel yourself turning a violent shade of beetroot as the passengers - bereft of any true entertainment - watch you pass by, obtrusively accompanied by two burly minders. Caitlyn sticks her tongue out at you as you pass her seat.

Upon being finally isolated from the others, you are surprised to find yourself taken directly to see the captain, currently looking over the in-flight controls for the aeroplane.

"What did you do?" he says, his hair in disarray from having run his hands through it a dozen times too many.

"Do?" you reply, unsure exactly where this questioning is going.

The captain turns in his seat. The moment he chooses happens to be one where a particularly bright flash of lightning shocks across the sky through the window behind him, backlighting him dramatically. Once it dies down, you can't help but notice his feeble moustache.

"My instruments all appear to be wrong, telling me a bunch of crazy altitudes. The 'plane isn't making as good time as it should be, and I can't seem to contact the outside world. You appear to be the only possible explanation."

"He had this," the gun-happy guard drawls, holding up your watch.

"I see. And what does this do, precisely, young man?"

"It-" Realisation causes you to pause. It makes the wearer shrink. "Um, in what way is the altitude wrong, sir?"

"It says we're a lot further from the ground than we actually are. I can SEE the damn' clouds - I know just how far up we are."

The lightning. Could that have somehow interferred with the device when you activated it the second time in the restroom? Instead of shrinking you down to avoid the guards, it somehow shrunk the whole jet? Meaning that it's the same distance from the ground, but proportionately a lot further...

"You need to land! Right now!" you shout.

"That some kinda treat, buddy?" the guard laughs. "Case you hadn'ta notriced, you ain't got your cheery little bomb or detonator, or whatever. We're doing nothing you say."

The captain seems disturbed by your sudden outburst. You presume so at least, from the way he begins massaging his facial hair. "Why do we need to land, son?"

"It's all gone horribly wrong," you gasp. "We're in terrible danger, and it's all because of that watch!"

"He's babbling now, captain. Clearly he's no use. I'll lock him up while you continue trying to get through to the authorities."
12121211122222.title: Larger Area of Effect

choices: The 'plane eventually crashes in a city park
The 'plane manages to pull off a decent landing in a driveway
121212111222222.content:
"No," says the captain. "I think of myself as a good judge of character, and this young fellow seems genuinely rattled. We're going down."

He makes signals to his co-pilot, and you watch as they both go through a complex procedure of lowering the altitude. The dark skies and clouds give way to a deeper darkness, before something monstrous skims out of the ether, rushing past above the vehicle and causing the whole cabin to shudder alarmingly, lights flashing.

"What the Hell..?" one of your minders breathes. You'd have liked to say something, but you're not sure how he'd take the news that you distinctly saw the shadowy form beat its wings as it crested overhead. Wings with a span greater than those of the aeroplane...

"We can't risk another near-miss," the captain screams. "We're going to have to get down, and fast!"

The aeroplane increases speed as it falls into a steeper dive, and you hope that the crew know what they're doing...
121212111222222.title: Hear Him Out

choices: Leave everyone else sleeping, and run off into the long grass alone
Try and wake the crew and passengers, to stick together
1212121112222221.content:
You've never been in an air-crash before this day, and you fervantly hope never to be again. All is noise and vibration, with the pilots shouting, the guards trying to hustle you to somewhere safe, strapping you down almost automatically in a seat. An oxygen mask drops from the ceiling, almost obscuring your view of the flashing lights, but not quite blocking out the green expanse that has filled the front window...

You're not sure how long it is before you regain consciousness, but it looks like you beat the crew to it. You wonder if you're experiencing shock or concussion at this moment, and before too long the panic of your situation floods your mind. You have to get back to normal size. You have to avoid getting arrested for terrorism. You have to stay alive.

Blearily surveying the cabin, you wonder what would be the best approach toward these goals.
1212121112222221.title: Parked

choices: Bolt
Explain it all
1212121112222222.content:
At an eigth inch long, the plane smacks into a suburban pavement. It rolls along the driveway's far side, going along a section parralleling the house and stopping at the edge of a forest backyard. In front is a coblestone walk-way littered with kids toys, to the right is a, a, oh crap!

The view to the right reveals a boy's flip-flop just sitting there and far, far, dwarfing the plane at 1200 feet tall, though at talk off that was just a half-inch. It was like the land of the giants, but far, far bigger things lived here. It was hard to believe the watch had done this, and even harder to imagine getting out of here. Beyond that, imagining your size in any helpful numbers wasn't going to be easy.

"What the hell?" the pilot said, looking at the landscape beyond the cockpit, a driveway bigger than the airport they'd left at, grass a few miles tall and a kid's shoe big enough to work as a runway. The structures beyond that blurred a bit and weren't exactly something anyone wanted to think about. He turns to you, "Explain!"
1212121112222222.title: The 'plane manages to pull off a decent lan...

choices: On the flipflop
Stay here
12121211122222221.content:
Like your going to stick around and explain quantum physics to these people and end up getting killed. You turn to run and fly back to the seating where quite rapidly you blow a release hatch and boldly leap out. You weren't sure if you were being followed, but knew you'd take no chances, taking off at the deadest of runs across the open plains. The aircraft behind you could get ahead, but not with the hatch blown and not without a good spot to take off and right now it faced a cliff-like drop, the stones of the driveway leaving it just a fissure in the Earth.

The stones created fissures to the plane, but you were able to find bridges between these areas, quickly jumping onto them and running for all your worth to the next one in line. Every inch was a half-mile, but you had to keep going. At one point, you consider growth, but see that the watch clearly is not in a mood to help right now. Eventually, you reach the flip-flops.

Beyond your sight, the kids footwear is a mountain. Some 'little' kid's foot ran the whole length of miles and moved that mountain every day. A look up the side shows that the kid loves to be outside with the mud, as its splattered and caked on all over the nearest flip-flop, making it resemble a real mountain to you.

Suddenly, the ground shakes and there's an enormous boom all around. You look to the stone path and see not 2 or 4, but 6 sets of mountains, meaning 3 kids. Two of the kids were in their early teens, their height to great for you to figure beyond their knees. You saw their barefeet stretch for miles and at least a half-mile tall at the lowest. Now, your thoughts turn to it being better to have gone south as a giant, if your feet were eight miles long to start with, the distance was only a few hours.

More shaking and booming draws your attention to a five year old right on top of you, his toes are nothing but mountains of mud, sweat and sand. It clicks that your nearest place to hide from the plane passengers and crew is about to go away.
12121211122222221.title: Bolt

choices: Beach/Pool
Grass / Park
121212111222222211.content:
Hurredly, you run for the mountain some kid calls his flip-flop, hoping to beat the foot to it. There was still just a bit of distance to cover, which had been irrelevant until the monsterous kids showed up. Sprinting, you just manage to leap on as the massive toes overhead kicked the flip-flop around to line up. A second later, forces that make pilot training seem mundane are forced on you as the kid walks to join his friends or perhaps siblings.

Despite the forces on you, refuge is reached as your arms haul you into a pore on the flip-flops, which itself seems large enough to house a starship. Inside, you claw yourself down to the foam to avoid being sent flying across the enormous cavern. Wherever the kids were going, you were sure it wouldn't be good for you, but there wasn't much choice at the moment.

Outside, you dimly saw grass rocketing by, but this small, everything at those distances was blurred. Suddenly, everythings shakes and tumbles, you look out to find...
121212111222222211.title: On the flipflop

choices: Beach
Park and Pool
1212121112222222111.content:
The enormous flip-flop slams down and hurls you out onto the ground, good thing you were'nt all that high up to start with. Hitting on hard concrete, you land on a mountain sticking off the concrete, one of those little bumps of imperfection from when it was made. Quickly looking around, you see this is part of a locker room, the changing area is next store, here people just store stuff in rentable lockers, that could hold cities.

There was a strong smell of the sea and a bit of chlorine, making this one of those play-area/pools by the beach. That couldn't be good for you, at this size, a grain of sand quite easily dwarfed you and a drop of water would spell your doom. There had to be a way out, then you remembered how you got in.

A brief glance up revealed the titans headed this way and really all over the area. The black-dirtied bottoms of the five year old's feet loomed overhead as he sat on a bench waiting on the others to be ready. They just dangled there but were mils off the ground, as if to tease your microscopic stature even further. Just a small movement from them left you surrounded in hurricane force winds.

The ground suddenly quakes and you look up to see the teenage titan toes fill your horizon, farther up, you see they are dressed for...
1212121112222222111.title: Giants and Lockers

choices: Escape
Wait
12121211122222221111.content:
Far, far, far overhead, you see the enormous teens putting their shoes on, indicating the boardwalk and then the beach. In the heat outside, its the only way to go without feeling like you were walking on fire. There were flip-flops and sandals, but not everyone liked them. Either way, your intention was to stay here and grow once they left, even if it meant a bit of fiddling with the watch, something which could strand or make you smaller, not that anything here could get much bigger.

All around, there's sudden movement. The five year old just leapt forward and yanked one of his brother's socks off his feet and then began running around the room at speeds quite greater than the speed of sound. A second later, the BIG brother has tackled him to the ground, the kid's enormous body is right over you, his brother's foot a few miles off and threatening to crush you as he stands over the 'little' kid.

Your world is dropped to darkness as the sock, perhaps up to 5 miles long is dropped on you. At this size of course, the many small spaces in the weave and thread itself are too numerous and large, leaving you to fit right through them. An instant later, you lifted with the sock and get a toe-point view of the way into the shoe. Looking around at the enormous structure, you felt like this was a ride into a gigantic city, it was certainly big enough to hold a fair part of any.

At last, you were plunged into darkness, the temperature skyrocketed and the humidity was unbearable. At last, the enormous forces of walking came in, global distances covered in a handful of steps. The question now seemed, could you escape or would you have to wait?
12121211122222221111.title: Beach

choices: Make it back to your former height
No chance, back to the shoe
121212111222222211111.content:
There had to be someway out of here, there just had to. Your mind rushed for any ideas as the G's continued their unending assault against you. There was the watch, but could it work? It had never been tested this close to the user and certainly not under conditions as such the plane had suffered.

Hurredly, you feel through the darkness to find the buttons and are overjoyed that this is a real LCD screen and it lights itself up. As your working, the G's suddenly stop and your sense of up and down is twisted until your unsure what direction is which. At last however, bright sunlight streams in as the titan gets his shoe off to take care of a small mountain of a rock.

Now as your best shot. Too bad it was also the worst.

Just as your about to hit the button, some huge girl skates by and catches the foot. It sends you lose of the weave your barely holding onto and onto the kids foot, bumping around on the way down. On the skin, the watch manages to slip off your arm just a bit, so that the metal contact is on the continent under it and you.

Wether its the result of something internal or the bumps on the way down your not sure, but everything grew before you, except the boy. The thing was, its easy to shrink something, but there is only a finite supply of energy with which to grow it. When the device found you could not grow the giant, it could have instead chosen to harvest energy, by shrinking. It was also possible the buttons were bumped on the way down.

It ends with the kid your former size and now he's just as big to you as earlier. With some very rough math, you deduce that a normal inch now stands in the hundred-thousand-mile area, making it such that an inch-tall action figure was 10 times the size of a planet to you. A kid's body would have the gravitational force to hold you and perhaps a micro-ecosystem.

The teen-titan you were on, was now just realizing his situation looking up at his sock sitting on the boardwalk miles away where it had fallen after he dropped it while shrinking. He had thoughts like you'd had earlier..
121212111222222211111.title: Escape

choices: With the kids
Survived
12121211122222221112.content:
All indications are that the kids will not be going far. Their toes are shear cliffs overhead to taunt your tiny stature and there's no evidence of any footwear. Both boys are in only their trunks and there's not a sign of any purse or otherwise to haul money and such around; which a girl would never abandon.

Still, your master plan isn't yet ruined. So long as you stay here until these enormous things are gone you'll be just fine. After the kids were gone, you could grow and resume your travels for your vacation. Happy ending for you, though the shrunken plane will probably never be heard from or seen again, except for perhaps by the five year old, who could end up using a real-plane as a toy.

Staying "here" however, is quickly made impossible. the feet overhead shot across miles at a good many times the speed of sound. The five year old in one kick made a force so much greater than any hurricane or tornado ever imagined, it swept you miles upward into the air from just the suction of air movement and then the wind carried you ever farther. Eventually it slowed down, at the kid's shoulders.

That was the fastest, farthest and highest for you, next to a five year old's shoulder while he was sitting and you wanted a parachute and a jet-pack. Below, the distance from shoulder to wrist, was an 8 mile drop. You were significantly lighter than normal, but your body was also weaker as that lack of weight was the lack of protection. The giant's body's had padding against impacts, miles of fat. That would protect you if you had that much, but then you'd weigh more. Effectively it all scaled.

You closed your eyes, afraid to see what was next...
12121211122222221112.title: Really Bad

choices: Water
Giant Attack!
121212111222222211121.content:
The boy leans to the side just a bit, a distance that is nothing to an inch, but is enormous to you and provides a nice landing zone on the skin, which to you is rough and mountainous. Your landing is rough, but you'll live on for now. Looking out and around, the world is defocused blurs thanks to your small eyes and the great distances to everything.

Everything shakes and flies in an instant as the muscles under you like tectonic plates twitched and shifted to move the arm a minute bit. After that, the boy stands up and carries you miles into the air, as best you can tell, he's headed for the door out into the light and the water. His arms rock forward and back along the way, pinning you to your little cliff of skin with the force of the miles-wide arc. Then, you manage to look up in time to see....
121212111222222211121.title: With the kids

choices: When you wake up, you're on the surface of the pool, apparently fine.
Something happens to you before you awake.
1212121112222222111211.content:
The boy stops suddenly, apparently waiting for something. It seems the pool hasn't opened yet, and all the kids were waiting in line. You however, keep going. The world blurs around you as you fly at speeds unimaginable to most men, and you hurdle straight towards the water. You realized at this speed, impact would mean certain death, but it was too late at this point to worry about that. Instead, you just hoped.

         Lucky for you, your size had you being whipped around in the air above the pool, preventing you from immediately dying. Taking this time, you cleared your thoughts.

Okay. Okay. I'm miles above a never ending surface of water that in minutes, will be filled to the brim with beings big enough to breathe me in without noticing. I need a plan. First, how to get down.

         You need not have worried, because a way into the water opened itself up for your. The kids finally were allowed into the pool, and twenty of them jumped in at once. The collective air flow dragged you down as well, but the impact from the kids on the water had temporarily destroyed the surface tension, allowing you the get in.

          Submerged miles underwater, you had no idea where the surface was. You only had a little time, but the shrinking allowed you to be able to handle the water pressure. The only problem was not drowning. Or not getting crushed. These titanic ten-year-olds were probably more of a threat than the water. As if to prove your point, an colossal wall of flesh smacked into you, shooting you out of the water, and knocking you out cold.
1212121112222222111211.title: Splish Splash

choices: Watch it
Climb it
1212121112222222112.content:
For the whole ride, your eyes are squeezed tight and you cling as tightly as possible to the foam, digging in with as iron a grip as you can. Now that at last it has settled, you look out to see as best you can tell, a mega-forest where the grass is measured in miles, not inches and where every single thing was so much bigger than you that it was just plain funny.

At the edge of the flipflop, you see there's ground, miles below you as the masses of grass easily hold the flip-flop's weight, now that its free of the gigantic kid who owned it. Of course, that didn't solve half your problems knowing the distance. Out there, a bug was a few hundred feet tall, a piece of grass held the strength of a mountain, and you were surrounded by beings who washed bigger clumps of dirt bigger than you off themselves on a daily basis.

The continent sized area of the park was among the most dangerous of places for you to be. Kids were going to be running around, throwing asteroid-sized objects, beasts that would trample you and never know it roamed all over, everything was a problem. Then you moved over to your other problem, escaping down a distance that some kid covered just by existing. You weren't too sure how to pull that off.

It seemed to boil down to craw out there and use the watch, hopefully grow, or freehand it the whole way down...
1212121112222222112.title: Grass / Park

choices: Going Up
Going Down
12121211122222221121.content: There was one way down from here, and that was the watch... Carefully, you steel yourself against the height, reasoning that firstly it will soon be non-existent and second, it was barely the distance from your little brother's heel to his ankle, if that. So, outside you climbed and slammed on the pre-programmed grow button...
12121211122222221121.title: Watch it

choices: Its on the playground
Its on a woman
In the sandbox
121212111222222211211.content:
The park was too crowded to just shoot up to normal height, so you decide to grow up to an inch tall. You had just reached your new height when you are suddenly slammed in the back by a huge gust of wind caused a stampeding children. Being an inch tall, the wind doesnt throw you too far, but as for the watch, it flies off your wrist into some unknown direction.

You collide into a blade of grass and slide safely down to the ground.

"Oh shit! The watch! Wheres the watch!"

You pull out your phone and activate the app you developed for if something like this did happen. It was a tracker and it told you to walk forward . You follow the directions until it notifys you that the watch is just up ahead. You look up and see...
121212111222222211211.title: Going Up

choices: Climb up to get the watch
Make the woman run off
Try talking with the woman
1212121112222222112112.content:
Brushing through the jungle of grass you soon track down the watch's location. While the children behind you thunder about their play in this park, ahead their mother sits to watch them, legs folded underneath her and skirt flowing outward around her. Somewhere on that gargantuan, your ticket out of here lies, no doubt caught in the fibres of her clothing.

The simple way to get it back is to climb up onto her, your inch-tall form easily capable of scaling that fabric slope. The only risk is if she sees you, and swats you like a bug.

Of course, you could always use that to your advantage: you could crawl onto her hand - planted firmly on the grass slightly further away like the landing gear of a titanic spacecraft - and she'll no doubt jump up, scared of bugs. The watch will be thrown free, and you can retrieve it while she runs off.

Of course, in her panic that same giantess could still stomp you into oblivion. Why risk that at all - why not approach her as a human being, and talk this out with her? You can save yourself from this nightmare, and maybe even think about retrieving the airplane later on...
1212121112222222112112.title: The Mother Mountain

choices: Bring her right hand toward you--she is letting you look for the watch.
The woman decides to stand up--you'll have to look for the watch in the grass.
Delay helping you by asking you some questions so she isn't feeling crazy.
12121211122222221121123.content:
Well, this is a challenge: you have to tell the giant woman in front of you that your watch is on her skirt, or blouse, or on her low heel pump--without her screaming because you look like a bug (from a far away point).

You try to remember that time when you did a project on the movie "The Borrowers" when one of the borrowers talks to a lady sitting by the lake. A simple "Hello" and the woman looked down--in the movie. Well now this isn't the movie, but it is worth a try.

You approach the woman's right hand, still planted on the grass, and without hesitating any more, you start with a simple: "Hello."

The woman looks around for a moment--she has heard your voice--barely. The children's voices at the park are drowning out other things--especially your tiny voice.
